p: Dubois sums up the two central aspects of the Black Death's spread in France. It is characterized by two features: (1) “almost everywhere, the plague has shown the bubonic form with secondary manifestations”; (2) “usually, it has been stopped or slowed down by the winter and then recrudesced in the spring” [ 52]. These features are defining features of rat-and-rat-flea-borne bubonic plague [ 12].
